result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
1:50 PM Defendant Nathan Robert Bjurstrom in court.  Attorney Melissa Louise Barrette in court for Nathan Robert Bjurstrom.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel files plea questionnaire. Court examines Defendant, accepts change of plea on counts 1 and 2 to no contest, and finds Defendant guilty. State will recommend at sentencing: Count 1 - 6 months jail cs any other sentence. Count 2 - S/W 3 years probation cs count 1 and any other sentence w/conditions AODA and follow up deemed appropriate, Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants, Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription, random testing. Defense free to argue.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Counsel appearing as a friend of the court. Defendant will be retaining counsel. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State requesting $15,000 cash bail with conditions. Court finds good cause to waive time limits and set case for status on prelim.
